intro: Lactuca albana, commonly known as white lettuce, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are white to pale yellow, arranged in a cluster, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. White lettuce is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, and it has been used historically in traditional medicine.
